name: Xisal_910672_Var04_r07_d08_a02_b02
description:
Xisal combines three separate periodic formulae, mappping each one onto a dot-matrix grid with separate ranges and offsets. Noise is taken from circular motion on a 2D noise field with its own radius and offset. These values are mapped onto a range of colours according to one of seven different algorithms, and rotation is added to produce interference patterns with a choice from eight rendering modes.
The initial seed for this loop of 300 frames is 910672, which selects function 2 with offset (-85.0, 0.0), range (6.6999993, -1.0), and function 2 with offset (-34.0, -5.0), range (4.9999976, 0.99999964). Noise is produced from sampling points on an ellipse at co-ordinates (59.0, -13.0) with diameters (5.0999975, 1.0). The three formulae are combined using algorithm 7 with hue values starting at 186 with range 80. The grid is 151 units square.
